channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Israel Was Less Flexible in Recent Gaza Cease-Fire Talks, Documents Show
item.description: The country made five new demands, according to documents detailing its newest negotiating positions.

item.title: Israel Was Less Flexible in Recent Gaza Cease-Fire Talks, Documents Show
item.description: The country made five new demands, according to documents detailing its newest negotiating positions.

item.title: Why Italian winemakers are fighting to banish ‘prosecco’ from your wine collection
item.description: Prosecco is one of the most consumed sparkling wines in the world, but some producers feel the name has become a hindrance.

item.title: Ukraine’s Surprise Attack
item.description: We explore why Ukraine is trying a new tactic two years into a stalemate with Russia.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: Palestinians Describe Dire Conditions in Gaza’s Shrinking ‘Humanitarian Zone’
item.description: An area of southern Gaza where Israel has directed hundreds of thousands of civilians to go has become a “hell” where food and water are scarce, people there say.

item.title: Billionaire Sir Jim Ratcliffe says he doesn’t wear a watch in London anymore amid Rolex mugging surge
item.description: The Manchester United minority owner has stopped flaunting his watches in London after 6,800 were stolen in the capital last year.

item.title: Nate Silver on How Kamala Harris Changed the Odds
item.description: The election forecaster discusses 2024 and what politicians can learn from gamblers.

item.title: Man Arrested After Woman and Girl Stabbed in London’s Leicester Square
item.description: A girl, 11, was recovering in a hospital after being attacked on Monday. The police said her mother, initially thought to have been stabbed, had not been injured.

item.title: Why The New York Times, Washington Post, and Politico won’t print leaked emails from the Trump camp
item.description: The emails from a person identified as “Robert” include a 271-page campaign document about JD Vance and a partial vetting report on Sen. Marco Rubio.

item.title: New Details on Gaza Cease-Fire Obstacles, and Musk Interviews Trump
item.description: Plus, scenes after a Ukrainian attack in Russia.

item.title: Where Students Run the Streets: Bangladesh in Limbo
item.description: The young protesters who felled an autocrat are now cabinet ministers and traffic cops, trying to restore order and chart a new future for a nation of 170 million.

item.title: This sleepy town in the Czech Republic known for its sweet pies and wooden houses just got $2 billion to help Europe compete in the global chip war
item.description: U.S. chipmaker Onsemi picked Roznov for a new $2 billion manufacturing hub in June. A contract with Volkswagen is already lined up.

item.title: Can This Country Show Europe How to Compete Again?
item.description: Sweden outperforms in tech, has a roster of $1 billion-plus start-ups and could be a model as the European Union refigures its growth policies.

item.title: Why Iran Has Waited to Retaliate Against Israel for Hamas Leader’s Killing
item.description: Tehran is under pressure to avenge the assassination of Ismail Haniyeh, but analysts said it is balancing multiple factors as it weighs a response.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz reveals EV battery maker names after South Korea car explosion prompted parking garage bans
item.description: The August 1 fire damaged hundreds of vehicles and created a national panic, with car parks across South Korea imposing a wave of adhoc restrictions amid growing calls for transparency on battery supply chains.
